group.label: Turnover Time and Rental Start Padding

field.label: Start date padding
field.comment: Use quantity and period. Format is like 1d = 1 day, 1w = 1 week, 1M = 1 month, 1m = 1 minute, 1h = 1 hour, 1y = 1 Year, 1s = 1 second. You can also use quantities other than 1 like 5d = 5 days
field.tooltip: How long you need added to the start date before you will take a rental reservation. Say today is June 1, if you put 1 day, then your client can't start their rental until June 2.

field.label: Turnover Before
field.comment: Use quantity and period. Format is like 1d = 1 day, 1w = 1 week, 1M = 1 month, 1m = 1 minute, 1h = 1 hour, 1y = 1 Year, 1s = 1 second. You can also use quantities other than 1 like 5d = 5 days
field.tooltip: How long before a rental is started is the inventory not available for. This is to account for cleaning, shipping, etc. For example if rental starts on May 15 and this is set to 2 days, then the inventory will not be available for May 13 and 14

field.label: Turnover After
field.comment: Use quantity and period. Format is like 1d = 1 day, 1w = 1 week, 1M = 1 month, 1m = 1 minute, 1h = 1 hour, 1y = 1 Year, 1s = 1 second. You can also use quantities other than 1 like 5d = 5 days
field.tooltip: How long after a rental is returned is it not available for. This is to account for cleaning, shipping, etc. For example if the rental ends on June 1 and turnover after is set to 2 days, then the inventory will not be available on June 2 and 3

field.label: Reserve inventory

field.label: Reserve inventory ending with return date

field.label: Reserve inventory until the item is returned in inventory
field.comment: Usually The inventory is reserved until end_date is passed or early return is made, but in this case if a return is not made, the item will still be counted as rented

field.label: Exclude Dates From Price or Calendar or Turnover
field.tooltip: This can be used for holidays (exclude from calendar) or dates that you do not want to charge for (exclude from price)
field.comment:
Exclude from calendar: Means it will not be selectable on the calendar.
Exclude from price: Means this date is not included in price calculation.
Exclude from turnover: if set to yes, this means these dates will not count as turnover time. Example: you have turnover time set to 1 day after and you have a rental from January 1 - 2. You have January 3 as a blockout date excluded from Turnover. So January 4 and 5 would be your turnover days (will not use January 3) and next available rental date is January 6.
